attributes.action:
Parties. Discuss Ministerial 
code breach in  Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The PM has been fined over 'partygate'. So the law was broken and the Ministerial Code is quite clear on what is expected of any minister who is found to have broken the law. It is flagrant disrespect to the people of this country who obeyed the laws during the pandemic and could not even say goodbye to the people they love. Boris has made a mockery of the Ministerial Code and it is imperative it is discussed in the house or what is the point of having the code?
attributes.background: To discuss in Parliament how it is possible that the Ministerial Code (See section 1, 1.3,  paragraph C) can be broken by our Prime Minister with no outcome as recommended by the Code.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  Petitions need to call for a change, such a different law or policy. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
